title: The Bachelorette: Angie Kent will address her endometriosis on an upcoming episode
text:
She has been open about her struggles with endometriosis in the past.

And Bachelorette Angie Kent, 29, is set to address the condition with her suitors on Wednesday's episode, according to Mamamia.

The blonde beauty told the website that she is looking to start a family in the future, but noted that a game changer would be if her partner wanted to start trying for a family now.

'When it comes to fertility that's my only real clock': Angie Kent is set to address her struggles with endometriosis and plans to start a family with her suitors on Wednesday's episode of The Bachelorette

'I've never overly worried about having a boyfriend by a certain age, I'm a big believer in universal timing, but when it comes to fertility having endometriosis, that's my only real clock,' she said.

'I have been very honest with partners that I do want kids, that it would have to be in the next five years. That would be a big game changer if they didn't, or if they wanted them now.'

Angie was first diagnosed with endometriosis, a condition where tissue lining the inside of the uterus grows outside of the uterus, in 2016.

'It would have to be in the next five years': Angie said she is looking to start a family in the future, but noted that a game changer would be if her partner wanted to start trying for a family now

After years of suffering crippling pain and long periods that would force her to stay in bed for days, she underwent a procedure to remove the endometriosis that same year.

She said that while babies aren't on the agenda in her immediate future, she wants to start addressing the symptoms now ahead of the next stage of her life.

'I don't want to wait to get to the time when I want to have a baby because it could be a struggle. But it's more for me just to know and be aware of, not manifest it.'

'It could be a struggle': Angie explained that while babies aren't on the agenda in her immediate future, she wants to start addressing her Endometriosis symptoms ahead of the next stage of her life

In the past, Angie has said that her condition has made her think about starting a family sooner rather than later.

She told NW: 'I do have endometriosis, so it is one of those things I will have to think about earlier rather than later because it will make things quite hard for me later down the track to fall pregnant.'

But she added she didn't have a 'timeline' of when she would start a family, despite revealing she'd found love on the upcoming season of The Bachelorette.

'In terms of my timeline, I'm not big on marriage or having babies. If my partner wanted to have that, I'll think about it. I kind of let the universe decide,' she added.
description: Angie Kent has been open about her struggles with endometriosis and is set to address the condition with her suitors on The Bachelorette
authors: Alisha Buaya For Daily Mail Australia
